titleStmt.title: Trevenen James Holland an Alfred Escher, London, Donnerstag, 16. Mai 1872

publicationStmt.p: Digitale Briefedition Alfred Escher, Zürich: Alfred Escher-Stiftung.

p.hi:
THE PATENT
TUNNELING
& MINING MACHINE
COMPANY.
LIMITED

18. Finsbury Circus,
London. E. C.Eastern Central (östlicher Stadtteil)

div.p:
From Lt. ColonelLieutenant Colonel (Oberstleutnant) Holland
President
of the Patent Tunneling Mining Machine Co.Compagnia / Compagnie / Company (Gesellschaft) Limited.
To
The President of the St Sankt / Sanct / Saint (heilig) Gothard Railway Company
Dr Doktor / Doctor A. Escher
Direction St Sankt / Sanct / Saint (heilig) Gothard
Bellevue
Lucerne
Suisse.

body.p:
I yesterday had the honour to send you a
Tender made by this Company for boring the Great St Gothard
Tunnel at rates which will complete the excavation of the
whole Tunnel, 14,800 metres in lenght, 6 metres in height,
and 8 metres in width in periods varying from 8½ years
to 3½ years on certain terms per metre.

I now enclose for the information of your
Engineer-in-Chief a photopraph of the Cutter-head and
Ram of the Machine which cut the 2.68 metres per hour
reported by the French Government Commission in 1868,
Copy of which Report was forwarded to you yesterday
with the Tender. I also forwarded by Book post
yesterday to your address the number of the «Mémoires
et Compte-rendu des travaux de la Société des Ingénieurs
Civil» from which the pamphlet attached to the Tender
was extracted.

In an article by Mons.Monsieur (Herr) Eugene Flachat on
«La Suisse et les Communications Transalpine» published
in the «Revue Moderne» in October 1868 mention is made
of this Company's Machine and of its applicability to
the St Gothard Tunnel, in preference to the small
drilling Machines employed at the Mont Cenis.

Mons.Monsieur (Herr) Flachat states that he saw the Machine
at work and mentions the rate at which it will
cut through granite.

I shall feel very much obliged if you will be
so kind as to acknowledge the receipt of this letter
by return post if convenient for you to do so.

I have the honour to be Sir
your most obedient servant

div.p:
Trev. J. Holland
Lt. ColonelLieutenant Colonel (Oberstleutnant)
President.
